moves.1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bf4: This is a typical way to make it more difficult for Black to accomplish e5.
moves.3... Bg4 4. e3 Bxf3: It's relatively unusual for Black to exchange B for N here.  It allows White a tempo (which can be recovered with Nb4).
moves.6... Qd7: Black signals intention to castle Queenside.
moves.7. c4 e6 8. Nc3 O-O-O 9. cxd5: This capture allows White to open the c-file against the castled position of Black's K.
moves.9... exd5 10. Bd3 Kb8 11. O-O f6 12. Bg3: This move surprised me.  I expected Bd6 to trade off the defender of White's K.  Instead, a piece gets blocked in.
moves.15. Qd1 Nf5: White is at a crossroads.  16. Bxf5 Qxf5 gives Black good chances with a Kingside attack.  On the plus side for White, Black's Na5 is misplaced and the Rh8 and the Bf8 are not even developed yet.  I decided that getting the c-file open against the Black K, getting the initiative, and turning the d pawn into a passed pawn were positional plusses that were worth the material deficit of trading a B for two pawns.
moves.16. Bxc7+ Kxc7 17. Nxd5+ Kb8 18. Nc3 Nd6: This surprised me.  I expected b5, although that position isn't very comfortable either after a4.
This surprised me too, as it leads to White picking up a material advantage.
moves.25. Nxb5 Rxc2 26. Rxc2: Now White has opened Black's King position, the Rooks are on open files, and Black still has two undeveloped pieces.  White has a material advantage and a positional advantage.
moves.27... b6 28. Ra2a8+ Kb7 29. Nd6+ Bxd6: This surprised me too, as it leads to a larger material deficit.
moves.30. Rxh8 g6 31. Rh7+ Kc6 32. Rc1+ Kb5 33: Rd7 skewers the B and N, gaining more material.
moves.33... Nxe3 34. fxe3 Bg3 35. d5 f5 36. Rg: Targeting a pawn that cannot be protected.
moves.36... f4 37. Rxg6 h4 38. Rxg3: This simplifies the endgame significantly.  Regardless of how Black recaptures, the passed pawn on the d-file, created back on move 16, is going to sail in.  White's R on the c-file prevents the K from getting to the pawn.
moves.38... fxg3 39. d6: Black resigned here as the passed pawn will be decisive.
